intro: Carex hypsobates, commonly known as the high mountain sedge, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia and North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in alpine or subalpine environments. Its narrow, grass-like leaves are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters called spikes. Carex hypsobates is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats at high elevations.
